title: Pam Bondi
deleted: In 2016, Bondi gave a speech at the [[Republican National Convention]] during which she led "Lock Her Up" chants directed at the Democratic nominee [[Hillary Clinton]].<ref name=Lavender>{{cite web |last=Lavender |first=Paige |date=July 20, 2016 |title=Florida Attorney General To Anti-Clinton RNC Crowd: ‘Lock Her Up’ |work=[[HuffPost]] |url=https://www.huffpost.com/entry/pam-bondi-hillary-clinton_n_57901850e4b0bdddc4d31c58 |accessdate=December 10, 2019}}</ref> In 2019, after leaving the Attorney General's office, Bondi was hired by Ballard Partners, a firm with close ties to Donald Trump, and she began working as a registered [[lobbying in the United States|lobbyist]] for [[Arab lobby in the United States|Qatar]]. In November 2019 she was hired by the Trump administration to help the White House in messaging during the [[Impeachment inquiry against Donald Trump|president's battle against impeachment]], being given "special government employee" status that allowed Bondi to continue lobbying meanwhile for Qatar.<ref name=Benen>{{cite web |last=Benen |first=Steve |date=November 7, 2019 |title=Despite earlier controversy, Pam Bondi joining Team Trump |work=[[MSNBC]] |url=http://www.msnbc.com/rachel-maddow-show/despite-earlier-controversy-pam-bondi-joining-team-trump |accessdate=December 10, 2019}}</ref><ref name=Ianelli>{{cite web |last=Ianelli |first=Jerry |date=November 6, 2019 |title=Ex-Florida Attorney General Pam Bondi to Reportedly Join Trump White House |work=[[Miami New Times]] |url=https://www.miaminewtimes.com/news/reports-say-pam-bondi-former-florida-attorney-general-will-work-for-trump-white-house-11312711 |accessdate=December 10, 2019}}</ref><ref name=Friedman>{{cite web |last=Friedman |first=Dan |date=November 6, 2019 |title=Donald Trump, Pam Bondi dives into the Swamp |work=[[Mother Jones (magazine)|Mother Jones]] |url=https://www.motherjones.com/politics/2019/11/pam-bondi-dives-into-the-swamp/ |accessdate=December 10, 2019}}</ref> Her job was described the following month as being to "attack the process" of the impeachment inquiry.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Rogers |first1=Katie |title=Movie Nights, Camp David and Cable Messaging: A White House Impeachment Playbook |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2019/12/11/us/politics/trump-impeachment-war-room.html |accessdate=December 12, 2019 |work=The New York Times |date=December 11, 2019}}</ref> On January 17, 2020, Bondi was named as part of Trump's defense team for the Senate impeachment trial.<ref name="Senate_Defense">{{cite news |url=https://www.news4jax.com/news/politics/2020/01/17/former-florida-ag-pam-bondi-named-to-trumps-impeachment-defense-team/ |title=Former Florida AG Pam Bondi named to Trump’s impeachment defense team | work= News 4 JAX |publisher=News Service of Florida|date= 17 January 2020 |df=mdy-all}}</ref> During the course of the trial, at which Bondi made debunked allegations that Vice President Biden and his son were tainted by corruption in Ukraine, it was revealed that a man at the center of Trump's Ukrainian scandal, [[Lev Parnas]], had several meetings with Pam Bondi in 2018 while she was Attorney General.<ref name="Bondi attacks Biden">{{cite news |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2020/01/27/trumps-team-dismisses-case-impeachment-weak-and-then-sloppily-attacks-joe-biden/ |title=Trump’s team dismisses the case for impeachment as weak — and then sloppily attacks Joe Biden |publisher=Washington Post|date= 27 January 2020}}</ref><ref name="Lev Parnas Bondi meetings">{{cite news |url=https://www.tampabay.com/florida-politics/buzz/2020/01/17/picture-of-pam-bondi-and-lev-parnas-emerges-after-she-joins-trump-impeachment-defense/ |title=Picture of Pam Bondi and Lev Parnas emerges after she joins Trump impeachment defense |publisher=Tampa Bay Times|date= 17 January 2020}}</ref> Parnas is under multiple indictments, accused of illegally funneling foreign money from Ukrainians and Russians to top Republican politicians; he was partcularly active in directing money toward politicians in Florida during the 2018 election.<ref name="Lev Parnas indictment">{{cite news |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/two-business-associates-of-trumps-personal-lawyer-giuliani-have-been-arrested-and-are-in-custody/2019/10/10/9f9c101a-eb63-11e9-9306-47cb0324fd44_story.html |title=Two business associates of Trump’s personal attorney Giuliani have been arrested on campaign finance charges |publisher=Washington Post|date= 10 October 2019}}</ref><ref name="Lev Parnas Florida donations">{{cite news |url=https://www.tampabay.com/florida-politics/buzz/2020/01/28/donald-trump-and-lev-parnas-discussed-rick-scott-in-secret-recording/ |title=Donald Trump and Lev Parnas discussed Rick Scott in secret recording |publisher=Tampa Bay Times|date= 28 January 2020}}</ref><ref name="Lev Parnas Ron DeSantis">{{cite news |url=https://www.orlandoweekly.com/Blogs/archives/2020/01/14/florida-gov-ron-desantis-wont-talk-about-texts-with-donor-indicted-for-foreign-influence-of-us-elections |title=Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis won't talk about texts with donor indicted for foreign influence of U.S. elections |publisher=Orlando Weekly|date= 14 January 2020}}</ref><ref name="Lev Parnas Republican donations">{{cite news |url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/lev-parnas-paid-his-way-into-donald-trumps-orbit-11579469071 |title=Lev Parnas Paid His Way Into Donald Trump’s Orbit  |publisher=Tampa Bay Times|date= 19 January 2020}}</ref> During a dinner with Trump in April 2018 in which various controversial activities were discussed, Parnas mentioned that he had had lunch with Bondi the previous week. Parnas' lawyer released an audio tape of his dinner conversation with Trump, as well as photos of Parnas meeting separately with Bondi on at least two occasions.<ref name="Lev Parnas profile">{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2020/jan/16/lev-parnas-who-is-he-trump-ukraine-rudy-giuliani-aid-scandal |title=Who is Lev Parnas? Soviet-born operator thrust into Trump impeachment scandal   |publisher=The Guardian|date= 16 January 2020}}</ref> By the time of the meetings with Bondi, for more than five years Parnas had a reputation for involvement in fraud such that in 2013 he started a company named Fraud Guarantee for the purpose of making it harder for people to use Google to find stories linking his name to the existing allegations of fraud. On payment of $500,000 by Parnas, Trump's personal lawyer Rudolph W. Giuliani acted as a pitchman for Fraud Guarantee. In 2020 Parnas was indicted by the DOJ for defrauding investors in Fraud Guarantee, which he falsely portrayed as a company that helped consumers defend themselves against fraud.<ref name="Parnas fraud">{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2020/09/17/nyregion/lev-parnas-charged.html|title=Lev Parnas, Giuliani Associate, Faces New Fraud Charges |publisher=New York Times|date= 17 September 2020}}</ref><ref name="Fraud Guarantee">

Bondi married Garret Barnes in 1990; the couple divorced after 22 months of marriage. In 1996, Bondi married Scott Fitzgerald; they divorced in 2002.<ref>{{cite news |last=Mitchell |first=Tia |date=May 30, 2012 |title=Attorney General Pam Bondi's Cayman trip wasn't a wedding; many wonder why |newspaper=Tampa Bay Times |url=http://www.tampabay.com/news/humaninterest/attorney-general-pam-bondis-cayman-trip-wasnt-a-wedding-many-wonder-why/1232844 |accessdate=December 16, 2014}}</ref>
